DOC.brief_summary: The objective study examine feasibility use collaborative-care , home-based rehabilitation program improve functional outcome people recover low limb amputation cause vascular problem and/or diabetes complication . The primary hypothesis rehabilitation program result great improvement performance-based participant-reported measure physical function , compare standard care outpatient rehabilitation .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Diabetes and/or Peripheral Artery Disease 2 . Unilateral transtibial amputation < 6 month prior screen 3 . Household ambulation ( well ) use prosthesis prior screen 4 . Participation physical rehabilitation prostheticuse train 5 . Within age range 50 85 year old 1 . Goal wheelchair use primary form locomotion ( use prosthesis transfer ) 2 . Anklelevel proximal amputation contralateral limb 3 . Traumatic cancerrelated low limb amputation 4 . Unstable heart condition ( incl . unstable angina , uncontrolled cardiac dysrhythmia , acute myocarditis , acute pericarditis ) 5 . Uncontrolled hypertension 6 . Acute systemic infection 7 . Pregnant woman 8 . Decisionally challenge volunteer 9 . Prisoners
